title: How to Tea Dye Muslin

steps.headline: Place six to eight tea bags per one to two litres of water in a saucepan.
Bring the water to the boil.
Turn off the heat and remove it to a cooler spot.
Push the muslin into the boiled tea solution and gently move it around to ensure that all the muslin is covered.
steps.description: Use a wooden stick or spoon to do this.

steps.headline: Leave the muslin to soak for 20 to 30 minutes.
Drain the tea and rinse the muslin in cold water.
Hang the muslin up to dry.
steps.description: It will look quite dark when it is wet but it will dry to a much lighter shade.

tyn: 6-8 tea bags per 1–2 liters (0.3–0.5 US gal) of water
Place to hang the muslin to dry
text: Place six to eight tea bags per one to two litres of water in a saucepan.  Bring the water to the boil.  Turn off the heat and remove it to a cooler spot.  Push the muslin into the boiled tea solution and gently move it around to ensure that all the muslin is covered. Use a wooden stick or spoon to do this. Leave the muslin to soak for 20 to 30 minutes.  Drain the tea and rinse the muslin in cold water.  Hang the muslin up to dry. It will look quite dark when it is wet but it will dry to a much lighter shade.
sentences: Place six to eight tea bags per one to two litres of water in a saucepan.
Bring the water to the boil.
Turn off the heat and remove it to a cooler spot.
Push the muslin into the boiled tea solution and gently move it around to ensure that all the muslin is covered.
Use a wooden stick or spoon to do this.
Leave the muslin to soak for 20 to 30 minutes.
Drain the tea and rinse the muslin in cold water.
Hang the muslin up to dry.
It will look quite dark when it is wet but it will dry to a much lighter shade.
